thread.title: Things to do the week of Oct. 18
thread.title_full: Things to do the week of Oct. 18

author: Staff report
title: Things to do the week of Oct. 18
text: Things to do the week of Oct. 18 Comment Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 10:00 AM By Staff report Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 10:00 AM Holland, Mich. Monday: The Boy's choir of the Mainz Cathedral in Germany, 7 p.m., St.Francis de Sales Catholic Church; free. Sponsored in pat by the Holland Chapter of the American Guild of Organists, this is a rare opportunity to hear this choir from Mainz, Germany. Monday-Sunday: Scavenger Hunt Week, 9 a.m.-5 p.m., Outdoor Discovery Center, 4214 56th St.; Free; (616) 393-9453. Join the scavenger hunt to celebrate the visitor center grand opening. Stop by the desk to pick up your scavenger hunt card, and explore the ODC nature preserve. Thursday: Cappon House by Candlelight, 6-8 p.m., Cappon House Museum, 228 W. Ninth St.; $8-$10; (616) 796-3329. An event for all ages, hear ghost stories, have your fortune told, and enjoy outdoor games. Friday: Fantabulous Friday, 10 a.m., Herrick District Library, 300 S. River Ave.; Free; (616) 355-3100. It's a dance party for children 18 months to 5-years-old (with a caregiver). Join in the fun with dancing, art, yoga and more. Friday: Jars of Clay, 7:30 p.m., Park Theatre, 248 S. River Ave.; $25; hollandparktheater.com . Don't miss this opportunity to hear a favorite band when it returns to Holland. The opening act will be The Voice. By Staff report
